headline.main: Ideas & Trends; A California Suit Seeks to Inhibit Machine Research

docs.lead_paragraph: The customer who buys a common tranquilizer under its heavily advertised brand name, Equanil, may pay $7.50 for a hundred tablets. But the customer who buys essentially the same drug under its generic name, meprobamate, may pay as little as 94 cents. The high cost of brand-name drugs taxes patients with limited incomes--and drives the nation's health costs ever higher.
docs.abstract: Ed supports FDA's efforts to encourage use of generic drugs; compares model state law pub by FDA and FTC with current NYS law (M)
docs.snippet: The customer who buys a common tranquilizer under its heavily advertised brand name, Equanil, may pay $7.50 for a hundred tablets. But the customer who buys essentially the same drug under its generic name, meprobamate, may pay as little as 94 cents....

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 18--Federal drug officials are considering plans that would sharply curtail the availability of Darvon, the synthetic narcotic painkiller that is the third most widely prescribed drug in the country, because it has been linked to 2,000 and perhaps as many as 5,000 deaths in the United States in the last four years.

headline.main: U.S. WOULD CURTAIL USE OF PAINKILLLER; F.D.A. Would Restrict Darvon Over Link to at Least 2,000 Deaths in Four-Year Period

docs.abstract: FDA officials weigh plan to restrict availability of Darvon, synthetic narcotic painkiller, because it has been linked to at least 2,000 deaths in US in last 4 yrs; drug's use reptdly will drop by 50% if placed in a far more restricted category under Controlled Substances Act; stricter control will be victory for Ralph Nader's Health Research Group; Dr Sidney M Wolfe, group dir, and Dr Robert Furman of Eli Lilly & Co, major mfr, comment (M)
